meanings.definition: To convert into a word or words.
meanings.sent1: She tried to lexicalize her emotions, but found it difficult to express them in words.
meanings.sent2: The linguist lexicalized the ancient script, making it accessible to modern readers.
meanings.sent3: In the game, players must lexicalize the secret code to unlock the treasure chest.
meanings.sent4: The artist lexicalized her thoughts into a beautiful poem that touched many hearts.
meanings.sent5: The teacher encouraged the students to lexicalize their ideas to improve their writing skills.

meanings.definition: To make part of a lexicon.
meanings.sent1: The new term was lexicalized into the official dictionary after gaining popularity.
meanings.sent2: As new technologies emerge, they are lexicalized to keep the lexicon up-to-date.
meanings.sent3: The children's game lexicalized the made-up language, adding fun words to their lexicon.
meanings.sent4: The slang used by teenagers quickly lexicalized into mainstream language, influencing the lexicon.
meanings.sent5: The professor's research lexicalized the regional dialects, enriching the lexicon of linguistic studies.
